intro: Placea grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered placea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with prominent, rounded petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or wetlands. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
